ja19:1.1: The story is that a merchant makes a sacrifice to ensure the success of his voyage, vowing that on his return he will perform another sacrifice, freeing him from his vow. The verse is riddling, so I translate literally and paraphrase in the comments. | “If you want to be released from your vow, only in some future life might you find release.”
ja19:1.2: “Because releasing yourself from a vow by sacrificing an animal only binds you to suffering.”
